thread.title: Celtic’s Nir Bitton Pays £1000 For Girl With Brain Tumour To Go To Disneyland
thread.title_full: Celtic’s Nir Bitton Pays £1000 For Girl With Brain Tumour To Go To Disneyland

title: Celtic’s Nir Bitton Pays £1000 For Girl With Brain Tumour To Go To Disneyland
text:
Celtic’s Nir Bitton Pays £1000 For Girl With Brain Tumour To Go To Disneyland Sun Feb 26 2017 22:36:59   22:36:59 GMT+0000 (GMT) Nasir Jabbar Nasir Jabbar in football 
Celtic midfielder Nir Bitton has cemented himself as one of the nicest men in football this afternoon after it emerged he payed £1000 for a little girl with a brain tumour to go to Disneyland. 
On top of that, the Israel international also handed over a signed Celtic shirt, in the hope it could be auctioned off to raise more money. (Bitton celebrates his league goal by gesturing a heart) 
The Facebook page 'Keep Jasmin Smiling' posted an update yesterday showing pictures of Bitton handing over the shirt, as well as an envelope of cash containing the instruction: 'Hope you enjoy Disneyland'. :camera_with_flash: ' Brilliant from Nir Bitton :clap: pic.twitter.com/ewNoDdVTIQ - Read Celtic (@ReadCeltic) February 26, 2017 
Jasmin's Facebook page simply states that Jasmin is dealing with the effects of a brain tumour and the page's aim is to keep her smiling. 
The most recent post details how Jasmin failed to make it to Celtic Park for the Hoops' 2-0 win over Hamilton yesterday but hopefully Bitton's surprise present helps to put a smile on her face. 
Fair play, Nir. Brilliant gesture! 
This story was first featured on talkingbaws.com - simple, shareable sport. Like them on Facebook and follow them on Twitter. Sponsored Links
